readability_reflection: I found string concatenation more readable, because I usually interpret anything inside of quotes to be part of the string itself. I'm relatively new to string interpolation, so I got somewhat confused when the interpolation brackets would be inside quotes for one question, then outside for another.
comprehension_debugging: The concatenation operator '+' was much more straightforward and readable for me, so I'd say I had an easier time answering the concatenation questions.
preference_rationale: I would choose string concatenation, because the idea of combining strings is much more straightforward for me.
learning_curve: I'm much more familiar with string concatenation while string interpolation is somewhat new to me, so in general the string interpolation questions did throw me off a little, especially distinguishing the difference between the brackets being inside and outside of quotes.
suggestions_improvement: I don't really have any suggestions or recommendations, but I can say the interpolation brackets would be much more readable for me if they were color-graded like in IDEs, and that the '+' operator for string concatenation worked well for me.
